At the same time, there are special needs that relate to
broadcasting operations that must be attended. Presumably
these services - particularly related to national programming
and distribution - would be taken care of in the new system
as well as the licensee representation role now carried out
by ETS (and NER) .
Fellows suggests that we update NAEB to become NAET, the
National Association for Educational Telecommunications
(or some such). This structure would continue to have both
institutional as well as individual members. Institutional
memberships would be reserved for licensees operating more
than one-channel delivery systems: radio-television
combinations, dual-TV operations, multiplex radio services,
closed-circuit and cable feed systems, etc. Associate
memberships would be for institutions operating one-channel
systems but interested in moving toward expanded service.
Individual and Associate memberships would continue as is.
Individual memberships could be doubled or tripled. There
are 9,000 individuals in educational stations and probably
20,000 all told who have an indirect or peripheral interest
in the field. However, I believe that NAET should not
become an organization of individuals only; a part of NAEB1s
distinction is that it has successfully combined management
and labor and helped realize individual objectives through
the advancement of institutional goals.
What services would be provided and how would they be financed?
Many of the professional services and some of the current
services now provided by ETS and NER staffs would continue or
expand. But the emphasis would be upon specific rather than
at-large representation that is our present major preoccupation.
The representation of TV licensees and their concerns about
program, interconnection, etc. would no longer be our
responsibility. NAET would not be licensee-oriented; that
would be TOP'S role. _-
Support would come from three basic sources.
1. Annual dues from institutional, associate and
individual members. -
2. Annual fees for special services (e.g.. Office
of Engineering Services)
3. Unit charges (e.g., personnel service, convention
registration, publications, consultancies, etc.).
